p: In standardising the extract in the present study, the amounts of rutin, apigenin, and caffeic acid were 40.15, 0.84, and 19.92 μg/mL of dry extract, respectively, using HPLC analysis. In a study by Proestos et al. ( 2006), the amounts of phenolic and flavonoid compounds were measured in aromatic plants, such as R. graveolens, in which the amounts of caffeic acid, rutin, and quercetin were 20.1, 40.1 and 3.1 μg/mL of dry extract, respectively, and the amounts of apigenin, luteolin, and naringenin were not adequate to be detected. Besides that, the antioxidant capacity of the R. graveolens leaf was 159.17 μg/mL in the DPPH method (IC 50), and the total phenolic content of the herb extract was calculated at 14.1 mg/g of dry extract.
